newsitem.title: INDIA: Quake recorded near India's border with Bangladesh.
newsitem.headline: Quake recorded near India's border with Bangladesh.

text.p: A earthquake estimated at 5.5 on the Richter scale was recorded early on Thursday near the Indo-Bangladesh border, Indian Meteorological Department officials said. There were no reports of damage or casualties.

The quake was felt in Guwahati, capital of the northeastern state of Assam, residents said. Earlier, Hong Kong's Royal Observatory said the tremor's epicentre was about 240 km (145 miles) northeast of the Bangladesh capital of Dhaka.
An official of the Meteorological Department in New Delhi said the quake's epicentre was near Bangladesh's border with three northeastern Indian states -- Assam, Meghalaya and Tripura.
"No damage to any property or loss of life is reported," S.N. Deka, director of the Meteorological Department at Guwahati, told Reuters.
United News of India (UNI) said the earthquake rocked Guwahati and its neighbouring areas.
